subject: Re: test to see if the output is a string or an interger
msgSnippet: Just a slightly different style, but basically the same test Levi had posted. public void testSomeFuncReturningOnlyAlpha()  { int testValue = 1; String
messageBody:
Just a slightly different style, but basically the same test Levi had
posted.

public void testSomeFuncReturningOnlyAlpha() {
int testValue = 1;
String stringUnderTest = someFunc(testValue);

try {
java.lang.Integer.parseInt(stringUnderTest);
fail("someFunc returned a numeric string (" + stringUnderTest
+ ")");
}
catch(NumberFormatException nfe) {
assertTrue("Expecting an exception from parseInt.", true);
}
}

-Eric

>
> return; // <-- exit the test method; we're OK
> }
>
> fail("stringUnderTest '"+stringUnderTest+"' was numeric);
> }
>
> Of course this is a complete guess on my end; It its not what you
had in
> mind; send in a code example :)
